tweets.text:
Have you spotted microplastics on the beach this weekend? 

If so please let us know the location and share any pictures as we are working with others to investigate. 

@wyrecouncil @EnvAgency @unitedutilities @LivingSeasNW @_MBay 

üì∏: Christine Taylor https://t.co/YunT1Gzg04

New Vacancy üëâ Engagement Officer: Green Recovery for Morecambe Bay's Woodlands Project üíö

Apply today: https://t.co/TF41ZIj7Nx

The Green Recovery Challenge Fund is a @DefraGovUK/@HeritageFundUK initiative in partnership with @NaturalEngland and the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/iOo3bvU6Ql

Another busy day for #TeamEA in the @EnvAgencyYNE patch. We‚Äôve had teams out refuelling our High Volume Pumps which remain operational where required. We‚Äôve also been receiving and dispatching lots of equipment from Selby Depot with the help of our specialist haulage contractors. https://t.co/vXniVjx28t

Last week, heavy rainfall from #StormChristoph caused #flooding across England.

Our staff have been working around the clock to keep the public and their homes safe.

There are still #FloodWarnings in place, so check your local flood risk now: https://t.co/X4IQl2YjjH https://t.co/YWbK4V6l3t

.@Guardian claims many homes & businesses are at risk of flooding due to ‚Äòruined assets‚Äô, but our blog explains more. 38,000 properties protected during #StormChristoph, no properties flooded due failed permanent defences & all assets winter ready. https://t.co/nB5wHJCW6i

urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: Yorkshire update: Despite river levels currently falling we still have 8 flood warnings and 7 flood alerts in place across North and East Yorkshire. The alert for the Lower Don has been removed. For the latest #flood information visit https://t.co/tumDuoEmi2 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/FYPn8VkFAS

I‚Äôve spent today on the ground checking our #pumps & #defences are working as they‚Äôre designed.

This is the rather picturesque view at Wistow, Selby where our @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam installed 3 #uHVP‚Äôs.

Still lots of water about but levels dropping nicely across #Yorkshire https://t.co/Ptm7XrqCcI

From this drone pic, you really get a sense of the huge volume of floodwater we‚Äôre dealing with at #Malton, thanks to everyone involved in the major pumping still ongoing to keep everyone safe @EnvAgencyYNE @NorthYorksFire @northyorkscc @RyedaleDC https://t.co/IfK1wLilUU

I have data from a survey, interviews and focus groups of almost 300 farmers where 90% indicated they are NOT willing to pay towards advice which is currently free at the point of delivery. Time to get some of that data published I think! @EnvAgency @NFUtweets @FarmersWeekly https://t.co/RopsokkzPV

JBA‚Äôs Event Response team is compiling an in-depth report for the #StormChristoph flooding, released later this week. The @EnvAgency reported 400 homes to have flooded in the UK as of Friday ‚Äì some of these shown below alongside JBA‚Äôs @FloodForesight forecast flows for the event. https://t.co/OUrQopt3zb
I'm very happy to let you all know that from April I will be going the @EnvAgency as a Senior Hydrologist in the Flood Hydrology Improvement team! #TeamEA https://t.co/GvqMKB0Vt2

tweets.text: @hslyfarms @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Very true. My plan is to really push organic matter from roots to increase the porosity of the sponge. Lots more fym, cover crops and perennials in the rotation.

@farmerbiff @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Definately seen the same at ours... but have to remember in nature the situation would never be there in my case. There would always be pereenial root systems..

@MBAAssociates @thisfarmlife @agricontract @EnvAgency @BarristersHorse You need to get a better idea about how rivers/catchments work before commenting. Ollie's explanation and solution are simplistic & worthless. Rivers are not drains. Rivers have always flooded. Draining water quickly off land into Straightened rivers causes more/worse flooding.
@thisfarmlife @agricontract @EnvAgency We need @BarristersHorse
@mortonmassive @voice_rural @agricontract @EnvAgency Rainwater harvesting should be mandatory on new developments.

tweets.text: @agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency Unfortunately it isn't as simple as that. Dredging has a wide range of negative impacts on rivers and the environment - it is also totally unsustainable. A network of connected floodplains is a far better option for a wide range of reasons. Dissipate energy, dont concentrate it.

@nocotu @SayNo2SizewellC @Jennife15046404 @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk Yes, the CO2 offset will be out of date by then, storage tech will have improved. We can build wind farms at a fraction of the cost, not put toxic waste on an eroding coastline & we can invest in our energy industry instead of paying EdF to rebuild France‚Äôs nuclear power stations

tweets.text: @SayNo2SizewellC @Jennife15046404 @johnnyrich @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk 14 years away. 10 yrs ago - see what PV panels were like / cost the same for batteries compared to here and now. That technology is improving on a quarterly basis and can be deployed virtually instantaneously.... the 2025 version will make the 2021 versions museum pieces.

@johnnyrich @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk The carbon from burning fossil fuels while waiting for Sizewell C to become operational needs to be added to the 5.7 million tonnes of carbon from the build, together with the substantial footprint from the uranium fuel & the backend decommissioning & 1,000s of yrs waste storage

@johnnyrich @SayNo2SizewellC @Jennife15046404 @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk Oh and to quote most of the TV chefs .... EDF already have one in the Oven called Flamanville - nearly a decade late and with mega cost overruns.

@nocotu @johnnyrich @Jennife15046404 @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk Yes, given EDF's experiences at Olkiluoto, Flamanville & Hinkley C, EDF know Sizewell C will be overbudget & delivered late (if at all!)...the question is, why aren't the UK govt acknowledging this & are prepared to force UK bill/taxpayers to subsidise French state-owned EDF?

@johnnyrich @SayNo2SizewellC @Jennife15046404 @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk I don‚Äôt think it is a case of rebuilding EDF - staving off bankruptcy may be more appropriate. If EDF are that good - why do they require the UK Govt to underwrite the cost and programme risk?? Simple answer is they know it will be later and massively over cost.

urls.title: ‚ÄòForever chemicals‚Äô: Firms pay out $4bn for toxic PFAS liabilities
urls.description: Chemicals firm Dupont and its spin off company Chemours have agreed to pay out $4bn to settle a dispute over environmental liability relating to the future effects of PFAS contamination, resulting from legacy pollution of the toxic chemical in the US.

@amichaelcruise @ConnorPR @EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @FloodForum @FloodArkLimited @FloodArk Similar situation. Had the quotes in for the terrace in November. Our flooding is solely through STW drains and we needed their agreement for some of our work to go ahead. They dragged their heels and only gave their decision a week before the flood - and it was a NO! Shameful.

@vivianne005 @ConnorPR @EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @FloodForum @FloodArkLimited @FloodArk We now have to wait for different consultants to come back to us for quotes on work. Could have avoided being flooded again had we carried out work that our consultant recommended 10 months ago!

@voice_rural @agricontract @EnvAgency We are working on min till as well. Agriculture is changing, more and more farmers are changing. Its not an overnight process though. What can be an overnight process is housing/ industrial estates catching there own water to flush bogs, wash cars water gardens etc.

@TimGue1 @powell_peter @agricontract @EnvAgency To turn a river into a water chute you would need have a sufficient and even drop along its length.  Otherwise upward pinch points - cities, ports, rocky beds, etc. will generate flooding immediately upstream. Rivers are shaped like trees, not lines, so a massive feat.
